oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Cpl. Charles Ward, Co. E, 60th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Quarterplate tintype of Cpl. Charles Ward, Co. E, 60th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA. He wears an infantry frock coat and a forage cap with the bill turned up. He carries a Model 1853 Enfield rifle musket. He was later promoted to sergeant. Born in 1841 in England, his family settled in Indiana. His draft registration lists him as a blacksmith. He later settled in White County, Ill. and died in 1920. See also wmca090, wmca091, and wmca093.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ward, Charles
